author: remyroy
content: I'm having some issues with the devnet-6 RPC on <https://rpc.pectra-devnet-6.ethpandaops.io/>. I'm trying to send devnet-6 ETH or perform transaction and it just fails.

author: jochembrouwer
content: How are you sending the tx? Are you sure that certain params like the `chainId` are correct?

author: remyroy
content: I was able to send transactions a few minutes ago. I also used the button to add the network to metamask on <https://pectra-devnet-6.ethpandaops.io/>.

author: remyroy
content: It seems to be back now üëç

author: remyroy
content: Could it be some spam protection? I can send like 1-3 transactions after which they just all fail for some reason.

author: parithosh
content: We switched to using erpc not too long ago, i think its having some growing pains :/

author: parithosh
content: could you try it out again?

author: parithosh
content:
Yeah that's gonna depend on your account with hetzner :/
you'll have to login to the panel, see what limits you have and modify the size used accordingly.

author: killari.
content: could someone send type 0x04 transactions on devnet-6? I don't think the chain has any

author: remyroy
content: I'd like to spin up a simple devnet-6 node to use as JSON RPC. I'm looking at client versions in <https://github.com/ethpandaops/pectra-devnets/blob/master/ansible/inventories/devnet-6/group_vars/all/images.yaml> but they are all pointing to docker images I don't have access to. Is there a client list with links to branches or commits I can easily find that are used for devnet-6? I'm happy to recompile everything from those sources.

author: pk910
content:
you should have access to all those images üôÇ
there is no authentication in front of that custom registry.

author: pk910
content: If it still fails for some reason,   cut off the `docker.ethquokkaops.io/dh/` prefix from the image name  and you'll get them from docker hub as usual

author: remyroy
content: Great, let me try that.

author: pk910
content:
not sure where you got the blockhash from,  but it's not the block I've sent you üòÑ
`curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" --data '{"jsonrpc":"2.0","method":"eth_getBlockByHash","params":["0xeba31f06425b86065f8b1990b94108a3ebc1d3e455d0df59645b982876db0cb1", true],"id":1}' https://rpc.pectra-devnet-6.ethpandaops.io | jq`

author: killari.

author: killari.
content: is it possible to get `eth_simulateV1` enabled on <https://rpc.pectra-devnet-6.ethpandaops.io/>? I get "method ignored by upstream: 94 upstream skipped"

author: pk910
content: should be enabled now üôÇ

author: killari.
content: hmm I get "method not found" now

author: killari.
content: and when I tried again I got: `'eth_simulateV1' is not a registered RPC method`

author: pk910
content:
uhm,  I kind of expected that tbh üòÑ
not all clients support that method and the load balancer doesn't know which client supports it
